### Introduction

`BASBL`, **B**ranch-**A**nd-**S**andwich **B**i**L**evel, is a [MINOTAUR](https://wiki.mcs.anl.gov/minotaur/index.php/MINOTAUR) solver for nonlinear bilevel problems.

----
Solving _nonlinear_ bilevel problems to global optimality is a long-standing challenge in optimization theory. 
Special cases of bilevel problems, such as problems of _linear_ (_quadratic_) â€“ _linear_ (_quadratic_) type, have been studied extensively and many algorithms have been proposed in the literature ([Dempe, 2002](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/b101970); [Floudas and Gounaris, 2009](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s10898-008-9332-8)). However, the general nonconvex form is very challenging and only recently the first deterministic method was proposed by ([Mitsos et al., 2008](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s10898-007-9260-z)).

`BASBL` is based on a recent Branch-and-Sandwich algorithm (see [References](https://github.com/basblsolver/manual/wiki/References) section for the theory behind him) which guarantees to solve a broad class of bilevel problems to global optimality. Moreover, `BASBL` is enhanced with several new techniques: reduction of overhead of the UB procedure, alternative ways to calculate tighter bounds, as well as alternative choices for branching and node selection.

### Running `BASBL`

#### Software requirements

In order to use `MINOTAUR/BASBL`, users will need to have a `MINOTAUR` installed (See [Minotaur_Download](https://wiki.mcs.anl.gov/minotaur/index.php/Minotaur_Download)). `MINOTAUR` is completely open-source and provides interfaces for `AMPL` and classical `branch-and-bound` algorithms.

#### `BASBL` solver's prerequisites

`BASBL` is capable of solving nonlinear bilevel programming (__NLBP__) models. In order to achieve convergence to global optimality:
* Explicit bounds must be known for all variables.
* All the functions involved in (NLBP) must be bounded from below and/or above and continuous on __X__ x __Y__.
* A constraint qualifications holds for the inner problem for all __x__ values.

The `BASBL` log output below is obtained for the bilevel model [mb_1_1_08](https://github.com/basblsolver/test-problems/wiki/mb_1_1_08) using the outer tolerance 1e-3 and the inner tolerance 1e-5.

### Output Fields

   __Field__      | __Description__ | 
----------------- | ---------------- |
    Iter          | The number of the current iteration
    Fopt          | The outer objective value
    fopt          | The inner objective value
 (Xopt, Yopt)     | incumbent solution point
    ILB           | Total number of solved Inner Lower Bounding subproblems
    IUB           | Total number of solved Inner Upper Bounding subproblems
     LB           | Total number of solved (outer) Lower Bounding subproblems
     UB           | Total number of solved (outer) Upper Bounding subproblems
    OVF           | Total number of solved Optimal Value Function subproblems
     L            | Total number of open nodes in the Branch-and-Sandwich tree
   Lin            | Total number of inner open nodes in the Branch-and-Sandwich tree
   GAMS           | CPU time reported by GAMS solvers'
   BASBL          | the total sum spent on GAMS and running the main BASBL program

### Termination Messages

`BASBL` will issue one of the following statements:

```
*** Successful termination! ***
```
This is the most desirable termination status. The bilevel problem has been solved within tolerances in this case.

```
*** Exceeded maximum number of iterations ***
```

The global optimality is not guaranteed in this case. `BASBL` will terminate with this message when the `--basbl_iter_limit` criterion set by the user was reached.

```
*** Failed ***
```

`BASBL` failed to find feasible/global solution. 

### `BASBL` Options
The `BASBL` options allow the user to control termination tolerances, branching and node selection strategies, heuristic for upper bounding procedure, and output (log) options as detailed in this section.

#### Options Style

In `MINOTAUR` toolkit options (see [Minotaur_Options](https://wiki.mcs.anl.gov/minotaur/index.php/Minotaur_Options)) by default are specified as `option-name` and `option-value` pairs. e.g. `--basbl_iter_limit 100` sets the option-name `--basbl_iter_limit` to a value of `100`. The option-names are __case insensitive__. So `--basbl_iter_limit 100`, `--BASBL_iter_limit 100`, `--basbl_ITER_LIMIT 100` are __all equivalent__. Option values on the other hand, are case sensitive. So `--basbl_global_solver BARON`, is different from `--basbl_global_solver baron`.

#### `BASBL` Options

  __Option__             |  __Description__                                 | __Default__  |
------------------------ | -------------------------------------------------| ------------ |
--basbl_outer_tol        | Outer optimality tolerance                       | 1e-3
--basbl_inner_tol        | Inner optimality tolerance                       | 1e-5
--basbl_global_solver    | Global NLP solver                                | GAMS/BARON
--basbl_local_solver     | Global NLP solver                                | GAMS/MINOS
--basbl_branching_rule   | Branching variable selection strategy            | YX
--basbl_selection_rule   | Node selection rule                              | Best Fl-lf
--basbl_iter_limit       | Maximum number of Branch-and-Sandwich iterations | 100
--basbl_ub_heuristics    | Use UB heuristic true/false                      | true
--basbl_log_level        | Verbosity of Branch-and-Sandwich: 0-6            | 2
